raw_affiliation_strings: At the present time, Lieutenant Bailey is on duty with the Production Department of the Norfolk Naval Shipyard, where he is serving as Electronics Ship Superintendent.

During World War II he served aboard the USS New York as Radar Service Officer and later became Radio Materiel Officer at N.O.B. Casablanca, French Morocco. Later, with the Electronic Field Service Group, he was sent to Antarctica with Task Force 68 on “Operation Highjump,” after which he took charge of the Electronics Publications section of the Bureau of Ships, Navy Department.

Lieutenant Bailey, born in Atlanta, Georgia in 1914, enlisted in the Navy as an Apprentice Seaman in 1932. Serving as a radio maintenance technician before World War II, he attended the Radio Materiel School, then conducted at the Naval Research Laboratory, Washington, D.C. He recently completed a course of study in mathematics and physics under Navy auspices at The George Washington University, in Washington.

affiliations.raw_affiliation_string: Lieutenant Bailey, born in Atlanta, Georgia in 1914, enlisted in the Navy as an Apprentice Seaman in 1932. Serving as a radio maintenance technician before World War II, he attended the Radio Materiel School, then conducted at the Naval Research Laboratory, Washington, D.C. He recently completed a course of study in mathematics and physics under Navy auspices at The George Washington University, in Washington.

During World War II he served aboard the USS New York as Radar Service Officer and later became Radio Materiel Officer at N.O.B. Casablanca, French Morocco. Later, with the Electronic Field Service Group, he was sent to Antarctica with Task Force 68 on “Operation Highjump,” after which he took charge of the Electronics Publications section of the Bureau of Ships, Navy Department.
At the present time, Lieutenant Bailey is on duty with the Production Department of the Norfolk Naval Shipyard, where he is serving as Electronics Ship Superintendent.
